main event: An orange teardrop-shaped object was observed for 3 minutes on March 20, 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as being orange in color and teardrop-shaped., The object's altitude was noted at 33 degrees elevation and 152 degrees azimuth., The witness concluded the sighting might be related to a missile test being conducted at the time., The object was estimated to be eight times the size of a fist., The sighting lasted a total of 3 minutes.
